title: How to Get to Dead Crone Rock from Markarth

steps.title: Fast Travel to the city of Markarth.
steps.content: Fast Travel to the city of Markarth. Markarth is on the far west side of the map. It has an icon that resembles rams horns on a shield. Open your map and select Markarth, a pop-up screen will ask if you want to Fast Travel there. Select “Yes,” and you’ll instantly get to Markarth from wherever you were. Once you get to Markarth, head out of the city through the main gate at the south. Right outside Markarth, you’ll see some stables. This will be your starting point. If you have not been to Markarth, you will not be able to Fast Travel to it. Instead Fast Travel to the nearest location and them make your way to Markarth. Alternatively, you can Fast Travel to Dushnikh Yal, Purewater Run, or Hag Rock Redoubt, if you've been to any of those locations. They are a little closer.

steps.title: Follow the stone pathway south.
steps.content: Follow the stone pathway south. Head south from the stables, either on foot or on horseback. Cross the bridge with the sign post towards Whiterun.

steps.title: Go to the gate of Dushnikh Yal.
steps.content: Go to the gate of Dushnikh Yal. After crossing the bridge, continue for a couple of yards. You’ll see a dirt path on the right that leads off the stone road. Travel down this straight path until you cross another stone bridge. Then continue on until you'll reach Dushnikh Yal. Dushnikh Yal is an Orc stronghold surrounded by wood/log fences.

steps.title: Find Purewater Run.
steps.content: Find Purewater Run. Once you’re near the Dushnikh Yal gate, take the path to the right. Follow this winding path up until you pass Purewater Run. It's a cave with a small creek coming out that immediately leads to a waterfall. It's to the right on the side of the road. You may need to get off the path you’re on to discover Clearwater Run. You can also continue on your course.

steps.title: Look for shadows of stone formations.
steps.content: Look for shadows of stone formations. As you travel down the path passed Purewater Run (you don’t need to go inside the cave), you’ll eventually come across another stone bridge. Cross this bridge and continue down the path until you see some shadows of tall stone formations on the horizon.

steps.title: Get to Hag Rock Redoubt.
steps.content: Get to Hag Rock Redoubt. Head towards the stone formation and you’ll reach Hag Rock Redoubt. Behind the rock formations, you’ll see a watchtower. A Forsworn will come out and attack you.

steps.title: Go through the watchtower.
steps.content: Go through the watchtower. Kill the Forsworn and enter the watchtower. Once you get to the top, you’ll see a stone bridge that leads to an open area. Cross this bridge and follow the path. Alternatively, you can take the path to the left and go around the watch tower. Go under the archways and passed the entrance to Hag Rock Redoubt Ruin on the left.

steps.title: Continue up the stone stairways.
steps.content: Continue up the stone stairways. Once you cross the stone bridge, you will see more stone steps leading up to the top of the ruins. Be careful as you make your way up. Watch out for the troll and the Forsworn Foragers.

steps.title: Find the entrance to Dead Crone Rock.
steps.content: Find the entrance to Dead Crone Rock. Once you reach the top of the steps, there is an ornate doorway made of stone on the right. This is the entrance to Dead Crone Rock.
